{"id":867439187,"question_id":271,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 5 months","timestamp":1672308621,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/867439187/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Encode and Decode Strings","memory":"N/A","code":"public class Codec {\n\n    // Encodes a list of strings to a single string.\n    public String encode(List<String> strs) {\n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        for(String s : strs){\n            sb.append(s);\n            sb.append(\"/\");\n        }\n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n\n    // Decodes a single string to a list of strings.\n    public List<String> decode(String s) {\n        int idx =0;\n        List<String> res = new ArrayList<>();\n        while(idx<s.length() || idx==-1){\n            res.add(s.substring(idx, s.indexOf(\"/\")));\n            s = s.substring(s.indexOf(\"/\")+1, s.length());\n        }\n        \n        return res;\n    }\n}\n\n// Your Codec object will be instantiated and called as such:\n// Codec codec = new Codec();\n// codec.decode(codec.encode(strs));","compare_result":"","title_slug":"encode-and-decode-strings","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
